summary:
Founder and owner of Duradouro, a company providing all-encompassing change management and Human Resources services to medium and mid sized companies as an out-sourced (interim) solution both ad-hoc and as a part-time permanent solution. Focus areas are supporting turnarounds and increased efficiency, change management, profitability and overall performance. As truly independent consultant and counsellor in a position to swiftly add value and ensure a significant impact on business performance for selected customers while keeping costs predictable (and low compared to in-sourced solutions).

Specialties: Consulting, Human Resources and Change Management

profile_positions.description: Dynamic, result oriented manager accustomed to getting things done and ensuring tangible measurable results and lasting change. Founder and owner of Duradouro bv a company providing all-encompassing change management and Human Resources services to medium and mid sized companies as an out-sourced (interim) solution both ad-hoc and as a part-time permanent solution. Focus areas are supporting turnarounds and increased efficiency, change management, profitability and overall performance. As truly independent consultant and counsellor in a position to swiftly add value and ensure a significant impact on business performance for selected customers while keeping costs predictable (and low compared to in-sourced solutions).

Focus areas are supporting turnarounds and increased efficiency, change management, profitability and overall performance. profile_positions.title: Director

profile_positions.description:
I was overall HR responsible for Euronext. Euronext is the first pan-European exchange, spanning Belgium, France, the Netherlands, Portugal and the UK. Created in 2000, it unites markets which date back to the start of the 17th century. It is the primary exchange in the Euro zone with over 1 300 issuers worth €2.6 trillion in market capitalisation, an unmatched blue chip franchise consisting of 20+ issuers in the EURO STOXX 50® benchmark and a strong diverse domestic and international client base.

Euronext operates regulated and transparent equity and derivatives markets, offering market participants a comprehensive range of services to meet their needs, including facilitating public offerings and providing trading facilities for equity and derivatives products to supplying market data as well as custody and settlement services. Its total product offering includes Equities, Exchange Traded Funds, Warrants & Certificates, Bonds, Derivatives, Commodities and Indices. Euronext also leverages its expertise of running markets by providing technology and managed services to third parties.

Euronext’s unique Single Order Book allows investors to trade, clear and settle in a uniform way across all of its markets and its common state of the art technology UTP, combine to generate significant efficiencies for clients. Together they enhance liquidity, lower costs and facilitate access to capital markets making Euronext’s market quality unrivalled, with market depth eight times the size of the average transaction and the lowest blue-chip spread in Europe.

In its role as a major player in financing the local economy, Euronext has a diverse market offering operating Euronext regulated markets Alternext and the Free Market; in addition it offers EnterNext, which facilitates SMEs’ access to capital markets. In 2013, through Euronext, more than €100bn was raised to finance the European economy, creating jobs and providing for growth.
profile_positions.title: Senior Vice President Human Resources

profile_positions.description: I was a board member of Geodis Wilson, the freight management division of the Geodis Group (part of SNCF). Geodis Wilson has some 9.000 employees in 60 countries. As CHR I had the full responsibility for all HR related matters globally. Besides that I was responsible for internal communication, innovation, compliance and training. I was also a member of the Geodis Group senior HR leadership team.
profile_positions.title: Chief Human Resources

profile_positions.description:
I joined LNM Holdings, the predecessor of the current Arcelor Mittal group in July 2003 as General Manager Human Resources, at that time the second corporate HR professional in the Group. From the start I’ve been involved in most of the acquisitions and turn-arounds that led to the creation of the largest steel company in the world. I have been involved in due diligence and acquisitions in countries like: Poland, Bosnia, Hungary, Ukraine, Turkey and Algeria.
Since the merger of Mittal with Arcelor (in 2006) I was appointed as Vice President Employee Relations and Benchmarking for the whole Arcelor Mittal group. The group produced at that time some 120 million tonnes of steel, had a turnover of EUR 80 billion, activities in 27 countries and 320.000 employees. My scope of responsibility covered all employee and industrial relations as well as labour efficiency improvements worldwide. Managed massive restructuring plans around the world and concluded EWC negotiations forming a combined EWC for Arcelor Mittal within an initial hostile environment. I travelled extensively (more than 90%) under hectic circumstances and with continuous changing itineraries throughout my years with Mittal.
profile_positions.title: Vice President Industrial Relations & Benchmarking

profile_positions.description:
Royal Packaging Industries Van Leer used to be a multinational industrial company, listed on the Amsterdam stock exchange, active in the development, sale and manufacturing of packaging for industrial and consumer products. Van Leer at that time had 15.000 employees, 150 manufacturing sites in 50 countries and a turnover of approximately € 2.4 billion. In October 1999 Van Leer was acquired by Huhtamaki from Finland, establishing Huhtamaki Van Leer, a packaging company with in total 23.000 employees, and a turnover of some € 2.9 billion. In my role as Human Resources Manager at the corporate head office of Van Leer (one of the two head offices of Huhtamaki Van Leer) my tasks and responsibilities consisted of all staff HR peculiarities for the group, but also the operational HR tasks for three Strategic Business Units (SBU’s) globally.
Restructuring, expatriation, pensions, compensation and benefits, hiring & firing, industrial relations, succession planning, etc where part of my scope and responsibilities.
Besides that I was also the country co-ordinator (with the final HR responsibility) for the Netherlands, Germany, the UK, the whole of the Asia Pacific region as well as North America. As temporary additional task I have been a member of the Integration Task Force to merge both European structures (between October 1999 and May 2000).
profile_positions.title: Vice President Human Resources

profile_positions.description: Hagemeyer at that time was an international trading company listed on the Amsterdam stock exchange with 20.000 employees and a total turnover of € 4 billion. My responsibilities as they were conducted from Hagemeyer’s head office in Naarden consisted of employment conditions, compensation and benefits, due diligence, share option programs, compensation Board of Management, redundancies and restructuring, operational HR work for the head office. Through Hagemeyer I became a member of the Contact Group of HR directors of Dutch multinational companies, a liaison vehicle between companies and Dutch government officials.
profile_positions.title: Specialist Personnel & Organisation

profile_positions.description: Dutch head office of the Belgian Solvay group. Solvay at the time was an international chemical company with some 40.000 employees world-wide. My responsibility was managing 3 separate payroll departments and businesses in the Netherlands for 2.000 employees. Main focus areas were: employment conditions; expatriates; fiscal affairs; payroll and personnel costs; redundancies; pensions and social security. On top of that from 1992 on I was functionally responsible for 3 complete Personnel & Organisation departments of manufacturing facilities in the Netherlands and HR liaison with Solvay’s head office in Brussels.
profile_positions.title: Head of Personnel and Payroll
